name: Rodney Gaines
text: This is my kinda track!  You're at home here, even if you're just visiting with someone else.   I felt welcome from the first person to the last.  Best part is whether you're a race fan or not, there are NO STRANGERS to be found at THIS track.  What you see is what you get when you're here. I've added a photo of just ONE of the driver/car owners that hang around.

name: Logan Williamson
text: It was amazing. Had a blast cant wait until next Saturday definitely would recommend to anyone looking for some good racong and good people 10/10 keep it up and let people drink in the pit again

name: Teddy
text: Always Some excitement going on that's for sure but it's a great place to bring your family and friends if you like some good short track asphalt racing.

name: Amy campbell
text: The road to get back to the race is enough to tear a vehicle up. The price to get in was 10.00. not bad. It wasn't anything spectacular.

name: Ryan I
text:
Horrible experience today! Last time my family came to watch was when Brian got killed in the go kart crash. The races were canceled immediately that day which I agree with. An announcement was made for a makeup race but never heard another thing about it.

My wife, 7yr old son, & I visit today to ask if this could be our makeup since the Baby Grands were running the cancellation day as well. We were told, "No it was too long ago." Really? I have always heard that this place takes care of it's people but that obviously was not on show today...

My son was excited to see some racing so we paid anyway. I can see why they did not want to honor it though because this place needs all the money they can get! All classes had at most 5 cars with the exception of the Baby Grands (special group out of Tennessee) and karts.

Buzz MIGHT have had 6 start with 3 actually finishing the race, but there was only 2 Pony stock cars. Seriously? 2? If Jody and his dad didn't show up, there would have been ZERO.

It was a pitiful showing for Buzz, Street Stock, Pony, Renegade, Roadrunner.. you know, the most popular classes at all other tracks.

The only race worth watching was the Baby Grands which were entertaining. Qualifying started a little after 2pm and the whole show was over by 4:30pm! Had it not been for some extended cleanups, we probably would have been out of there by 4.

Speaking of extended cleanups, a whole car burned to the ground in turn 1 last weekend. Today the #1 car catches fire and at least they used an extinguisher on it. Someone did throw a piece of the hot car over the wall though, which the fire crew had to hurry and go get before it caught the hillside on fire. Seriously, this is more of a circus than a race track.

It's sad too because this used to be a fun place to come. The hillside would be covered with racecars and spectators, now it's just laughable. My kart will never run here and my car's tires will never touch the pavement again, I can guarantee that.

If you are looking for good racing, my advice is to visit Sayre, ECM, or just roll 2 quarters down a 2x4. Even that would be better than what we witnessed today.

I hope you frame that $25. It's the last money you will see from us. Sorry to post this Kenny. I'm not sure if you are still running this or not but it has went downhill.

name: Anthony barbee
text: Great racing and family atmosphere! And also a bargain for the price to get into the race.

name: Tony Roberts
text: We were there for their Jasper Speedway Spooktacular.  They hosted a trunk or treat for kids before the races.  They then had super racing, lots of cars and even go kart racing!  GREAT PLACE TO CARRY THE FAMILY!!

name: kelsie reach
text: Great place for the family to have a good time! Great people running the place!

name: blaine self
text: Fun place to go with good food from the grill. But the side for the Pits is too expensive for people to go over there. It use to be nice to be able to sit in your car and watch the races. It was the best part about the track. But now it’s just to expensive to go to that side. Good racing and good times when I go, just a little to costly for the pit side.

text: Except the girls shower had no hot water

name: Joe Gerard
text: Insanely nice owner. I came here for a track day and the man was very kind, immediately greeting us and then once everyone was there, him and his wife introduced us all to the track and cooked a home cooked meal for us all for lunch, and really love that they made everyone instantly feel like family. Also love the ducks they have there.

name: Pete Panaia
text: I love this place! It just keeps getting better and better! The owner (Ken) is a great guy! The staff there is awesome!

name: Anthony Beasley
text: Absolutely one of the best tracks I've been to. Last weekend every month $150 gets you all day to slide with pride. They also offer bike racing and kart racing.

name: Andrew O.
text:
Follow me on Instagram: a.leestudios

Best track I've been.

Ken is the man.

name: Jay Reed (JargonJC)
text:
A wonderful experience for any Motorhead. The track has several tight turns that will test your car and it does not matter what kind of car you have. I have a Volvo wagon and I kept up with my friend and their Miata.

Every third Sunday of the month is when they have open track days and the cost is $75 for all day access. The owner even cooked us lunch on a grill.

name: cody king
text: Went as just a spectator, pulled my buddies car for him had a blast spite the heat. 10/10 recommend.

name: Elsea’s World
text: I am proud to call Midpond my home track. Ken works extremely hard to keep the landscape perfect and it shows. Track is nice and tight, makes for great drifting!

name: Jeremy Lester
text: Hands down the most inviting atmosphere of any track. Owner in incredibly nice and accommodating. Always making improvements and conscious of making the track safe for drivers and cars. Will definitely be making a trip back down in the future the whole way from PA!

name: David Shaddix
text: Raw, Ridiculous,  Ripping Fun!

name: Edward Lee
text: Awesome race track. Ken, the owner, is awesome. He let us camp anywhere on his racetrack and even let us use his fire pit to cook and keep warm. I'll be back soon for more drift events. Thanks Ken!

name: James Drumheller
text: Love this place

name: Christopher Lovett
text: Awesome place great people awesome staff.

name: Josh Halterman
text: Absolutely fantastic. Great track, tons of seat time, and tons of fun. Ken, the owner, is an awesome guy. Definitely coming back!

name: Cory Grimm
text: This is an oasis in the desert! The only place that runs minimoto for hours. The track surface adds a certain ... challenge to making a fast lap, but Midpond is a great track! The owner is awesome and has a true passion for motorsports. If you get a chance to come to Midpond in a car or on a motorcycle, take it!

text: Small, tight track. Low fees, maximum seat time, tons of fun!
